intro: Alepyrum, commonly known as the "garden spurge," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers. Alepyrum species are often characterized by their milky sap, which can be toxic. They are generally shrubs or subshrubs, growing in a variety of habitats including rocky soils and open woodlands.
